results.title: More homes for more people
results.creator_credit: Anthony Short, Gordon Sparling and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film shows materials used in all stages of construction of three sets of semi-detached Canadian-style homes in the United Kingdom. The film was intended to encourage more builders to make their homes from Canadian lumber and by Canadian methods. Sir Donald Gibson, director general of research and development, reports on observations made in Canada.

results.title: More great escapes of World War 2
results.creator_credit: Robert Kirk, A&E Television Networks and Greystone Communications
results.brief_description: The second volume of a television documentary series made for The History Channel that chronicles legendary breakouts by prisoners of war during World War II contains two more episodes: “The escape from the USS Oaklahoma” and “The escape from Dunkirk: the way out”. Archival footage is combined with dramatic recreations and first person testimony to bring to life the courageous acts of civilians, soldiers and the resistance in WWII. “The Great Escapes of WWII” is also available.

results.title: More common than measles and mumps
results.creator_credit: David Grimes, Kiloran German, ONF | NFB and Student Animated Film Producers
results.brief_description: An animated film for inclusion in programs of sex education for young people. The subject is venereal disease and the film was produced by young film-makers. The approach is in the form of a cartoon reporting the findings of two students assigned to investigate venereal disease as part of a health studies classroom project. The facts they gather, and convey in this film, are what all young people should know.

results.title: More bloody meetings: the human side of meetings (NP)
results.brief_description: The sequel to “Meetings, Bloody Meetings”. “More Bloody Meetings” aims to develop the interpersonal skills of chairpersons. Demonstrates techniques to improve people handling skills at meetings in order to improve the decision making process. Features John Cleese and Graeme Garden. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: More animation greats!
results.brief_description: This disc features a collection of short animated works, produced by the National Film Board of Canada. The contents include: “Cactus swing”. Fun musical short celebrating desert flora and fauna. “La Salla”. Unusual, inventive and fun animated piece about one man exploring his environment, whilst singing Italian opera (with English subtitles). “64 Million years ago”. Stop-motion animated piece that recreates the world of the dinosaur. “Evolution” Humorous illustration about the natural process of evolution. “Hot stuff” Award winning film about fire as the servant of man. “Every dog’s guide to home safety” Hilariously addresses home safety for infants and young children. “The Family that dwelt apart” E. B. White story about a family of seven fisher folk living on a remote island. “The Dingles” The story of Doris Dingles and her three cats one wild and windy day. “Every child = Chaque enfant” The story of a baby who appears mysteriously on the door of a busy executive, and who is subsequently bounced from household to household. These fine works feature world-class animation that delves into children’s rights, relationships, animal behaviour and human frailty. The following works are also available on 16 mm: Hot stuff [012477], Every dog’s guide to home safety [316176], The Family that dwelt apart [012488], The Dingles [301088], The Old Lady’s camping trip [016425], Every child [307146].

results.title: Moral judgement and reasoning (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines various concepts of moral development as postulated by Freud, Piaget and Kohlberg and points out that moral knowledge comes to a child from many sources, including parents, older siblings and playmates.

results.title: Mooti: child of New India
results.creator_credit: J. Michael Hagopian and Atlantis Productions
results.brief_description: The story of a Hindu village boy who plays a part in a changing India. Through Mooti’s eyes are presented the three major concepts of the film: change to new tools, change to new industries, change to new relationships.

results.title: Moonwalk
results.creator_credit: Theo Kamecke, Peretz Johnnes, Dean Gitter Productions and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: A record of the journey that culminated in man’s first step on the moon, covering the spectacular blastoff, the lunar landing and the return to earth. Effective use of music, sound effects and slow motion. Includes images taken from inside the lunar module.

results.title: Moonraker (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Lewis Gilbert, Albert R. Broccoli, Danjaq and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: James Bond (Roger Moore) goes sci-fi in “Moonraker”, sourcing a missing space shuttle that has vanished in transit. A survey of the crash site reveals no evidence of the Moonraker; hijacking is the only explanation. Heading to California, Bond makes contact with billionaire Hugh Drax (Michael Lonsdale), head of Drax Industries and creator of the shuttle, as well NASA scientist and CIA Agent Dr Holly Goodhead (Lois Charles). Their paths cross again in Venice where Bond discovers a highly toxic nerve gas created from a rare orchid. The film culminates at a space station where a show down takes place with the megalomaniac Drax, intent on inflicting mass genocide and beginning a super race of perfect human specimens created in his image. Highlights include a centrifuge simulator, lethal Dobermans, a gondola chase, an out of control cable car and the return of the deadly steel-toothed killer, Jaws (Richard Kiel).

results.title: Moon shot
results.creator_credit: Kirk Woltinger, TBS and Varied Directions International
results.brief_description: Share the excitement, drama, passion and power of this landmark event in this fascinating program. Utilising an untapped treasure of NASA tapes, home movies, and never-before-seen footage of the Soviet space program, astronauts Alan Shepard and Deke Slayton guide the viewer through the real story behind the space program. Re-live the historical moments of Joh Glenn’s breathtaking orbit, Apollo 11’s 1969 moon landing and the tragic Apollo 1 fire. Share the magic once again in this inspiring celebration of mankind’s greatest achievement.
